name: North Macedonia
takeaway: The results indicate that academia remains a key component of PRC influence in North Macedonia. North Macedonia’s higher education institutions largely cooperate with their counterparts from China through bilateral projects, and the number of these projects in some areas surpasses that with Western countries. This is also in sharp contrast to other economic and political parameters in which China is far less present.

Another key component of Chinese strategic messaging in North Macedonia is through Chinese culture. This allows China to paint an idealized picture of itself as a culturally rich, successful and benevolent entity among citizens who are otherwise less informed about Chinese current events and life.

The penetration of China in the Technology and Economy Domains has been practically stalled in recent years. In 2023, there was a noticeable lack of new key agreements for supply of sensitive equipment and technologies owing to the fact that North Macedonia has enforced the bulk of Western restrictions.
description-1: In 2023, North Macedonia had a GDP per capita of US$8,146 and a total estimated population of 1.84 million people. According to the last official census in 2021, the Chinese population totalled 8 people, or 0.00043% of the total population.
description-2: North Macedonia established diplomatic relations with the People’s Republic of China in 1993. North Macedonia was ranked 36th in Reporters Without Borders 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Partly Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 67/100.

Media.evidence: There is no media organisation from the country listed as belonging to ther WCM network.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: After checking the relevant websites, we also additionally checked with an expert from the Macedonian Insitute for Media, MIM, who confirmed that they have not encountered this phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The last time media professionals from North Macedonia's national news agency, MIA, traveled to China was 2019; since then there have been no such visits. This has been checked with employees and management of MIA. Additionaly, one source from the government with a professional background in journalism, told us that he had not observed similar cases regarding other media outlets either.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the Indicator phenomenon.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Checking the databases of media ownership in Northe Macedonia revealed no such cases. Aditionaly, a consultation with a media expert from the Asociation of Journalists of Macedonia, AJM, further corroborted this point.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: MIA who once had a content-sharing Agreement with the Chinese state news agency, no longer has such an agreement and it also does not have a correspondent there. I was told this is due to financial reasons as in general MIA had to cut expenses and does not have similar agreements also with many Western agencies. Thus, usually these news on China that are produced by MIA journalists are based on information either found in world media outlets, or in media in neighbouring Serbia, [where the language is more comporehendable], but the source is not disclosed.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: Only the mouthpiece of the small pro-Russian and anti-Western Levica party, the news portal called antropol.mk, has from time to time published articles describing relations as based on these pillars. In one instance the emotional issue of North Macedonia's name was used to stir symphaty, owing to the fact that China does not and did not problematise the country's name and had allowed the Levica representative participating in activities there to name his country under the old official name, Republic of Macedonia. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" ratring. However, both this party and this outlet are small and marginal in North Macedonia. Therefore, this indicator deserves an 'insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Media.note: Although aforementioned antropol.mk news portal often covers China in a positive light, we have encountered no instances where this or any other outlet or media personality outright denied existence of human rights abuses. If anything, this entity seems to stir away from such toppics.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: The current composition of this Parliamentary Cooperation Group for Cooperation with the Parliament of the PRC includes the following MP’s: Vlado Misajlovski as group president, members include Lidija Petkoska, Igor Zdravkovski, Marija Georgievska, Jovan Mitreski, Goran Misovski, Bajram Kadrija and Afrim Gashi. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.note: Worth noting that this year we have not observed any significant forms of cooperation or comunication between the two parliaments. The last time when North Macedonia's Parliament Speaker Talat Xhaferi visited China, leading an delegatiuon of legislators, was in 2019. That was also the last time a Chinese parliamentary delegation visited North Macedonia.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: During the breakout of the COVID-19 crisis, North Macedonia saw notable aid in medical equipment, foremost masks and vaccines from China. Therefore, the indicator deserves a "More than a few rating". This was done in a period when the country was struggling to procure any significant amount of such medical necessities from its western partners, and came as a soft diplomacy win for PRC. Therefore, the indicator deserves a "Significant" rating. In addition, PRC also occasionally donates other types of equipment, like IT equipment, to local municipalities in North Macedonia.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: When it comes to Taiwan, there is no evidence that North Macedonia has used the PRC's stand. The country in 1999 recognised Taiwan with an expectance that Taiwan would direct significant investments, and in what was later described as the "Taiwan adventure" lost the support of China as a key country in the UN Security Council. In 2011 Skopje revoked the recognition of Taiwan and that same year it reestablished diplomatic ties with China. However, cooperation with Taiwan has remained somewhat active on the economic level as witnessed by a recent announcement of a significant Taiwanese investment this year as testified by the link.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: With some 20 scientific projects which are mostly concentarated in the three biggest state univerisities in North Macedonia - the Sts. Cyril and Methodius in Skopje, Goce Delcev in Shtip and the University of Information Technology St. Paul the Apostole in Ohrid - PRC and PRC conected entities are seen as very well established in North Macedonia's academic sphere. On the other hand, information from more than ten private faculties and educational facilitiies in North Macedonia shows that their cooperation with PRC entities has been much more sporadic. Therefore, this indicator seserves a "Few" rating. However, given that PRC entities are present with long-standing partnerships in the three biggest and most significant universities, the significance cannot be understated as they often offer a competent alternative to cooperation with Western companies and academic centres. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" ranking.
Academia.note: Huawei’s Seeds for the Future project has been sending Macedonian students on study visits to China. In 2012 Huawei was chosen for the government project aiming to supply tablets for high school pupils and university students. The project is now inactive. Yet the main cooperation between Macedonian research facilities and Chinese counterparts is well developed. It is based on the two cooperation agreements that North Macedonia has signed with China. The Ministry of Education undertakes cooperation on the basis of the Agreement on Cooperation in the field of education, signed on December 5, 2007, in Beijing. The Scientific and technological cooperation agreement between the Government of the Republic of North Macedonia and the Government of the People’s Republic of China, was signed on March 7 1995 in Skopje. According to North Macedonia’s Education Ministry there are currently over 20 scientific cooperation projects, concluded or active. Among them is the cooperation project between Skopje’s Institute for Earthquake Engineering and the Dalian University of Technology in 2018 and 2019. Another example is the cooperation between  Skopje’s state Faculty of Electronic Technical and Information Sciences, FEIT, with the School of Electronics and IT at the Xian Zhu university. Together they have worked on early diagnostics and error prevention for the Chinese rapid railroad system. Huawei’s Seeds for the Future project has been sending North Macedonia students on study visits in China which is evident by the yearly calls for scholarships which amount to around ten each year.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: The Confucius Institute in Skopje is the only one in the country and is opened in 2013 at the oldest and most renowned public University, "St. Cyril and Methodius". Moreover, there are Confucius classrooms open in a number of municipalities across the country. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. A research report dubbed "Understanding the tools, narratives and influence of Chinese 'soft power' in North Macedonia" by the author Ana Krstinovska, which was published by ESTIMA and the Konrad Adenauer Foundation near the end of 2022, points out that probably the most important long-term tool for strengthening Chinese soft power in North Macedonia is the opening of this institute. This has resulted in gradual but constant increase of studentrs who learn or have learned the Chinese language and culture which currenlty accounts for several hundred people. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.note: Aditionally, sources tell us that Confucius classrooms do exist in a number of municipalities across the country but according to this source they offer only language classes.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: While the country does not have such plans or arrangements in place, there is evidence that at least one significant municipality has made such arrengements this year. In June 2023 Skopje's Karposh municipality [which is one of the biggest urban municipalities in the capital Skopje] and its head, Stevco Jakimovski, hosted the Chinese Ambassador to the country to mark 30 years of establishment of bilateral relations between the two countries. During the occasion, this opposition mayor signed a memorandum of cooperation with the Confucius institute so that the pupils of this municipality can attend Chinese language courses.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Academia.note: From the publically available data and from talks with experts it does not appear that think tanks and research centres in North Macedonia directly belong to PRC affiliated networks and associations. However, the presence of China based think tanks and their cooperation with North Macedonia’s institutions is visible. In 2018 North Macedonia hosted the fifth symposium of think tanks from China and Central and Eastern Europe as part of the 16+1 cooperation initiative. Addressed by the then North Macedonia PM Zoran Zaev, the symposium was held in the Macedonian Academy of Sciences and Arts and was organised by the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences and North Macedonia’s Institute for Geostrategic Studies and Foreign Policy of the Foreign Affairs Ministry.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In June 2023 Skopje's Karposh municipality [which is one of the biggest urban municipalities in the capital Skopje] and its head, Stevco Jakimovski, signеd a cooperation memorandum with the Confucius Institute that will allow school children to learn the Chinese language. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, this is the only example available through publically available data. Therefore, this Indicator deserves and "insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: The capital Skopje’s sister city is Nanchang. The town of Prilep is a sister city of Deyang in China. The town of Ohrid has a sister city in Dalian, China. Therefore, this indicastor deserves a "Few" rating. Hopwever, the cooperation between these sister cities is fairly limited, restrained to few donations of masks during the COVID-19 pandemic and on rare mutual visits of cordial nature but with little to no practical meaning, last of which was reported in 2018. Therefore, this indicator deserves an 'insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In June 2023 Skopje's Karposh municipality [which is one of the biggest urban municipalities in the capital Skopje] and its head, Stevco Jakimovski, hosted the Chinese Ambassador to the country to mark 30 years of establishment of bilateral relations between the two countries and sign a cooperation memorandum that will allow school children to learn the Chinese language. In February the Chinese Ambassador visited the small rural municpaity of Zrnovci where he talked about development of rural and ethno tourism where China is interested to help. In June he visited the town of Kriva Palanka where he donated garbage bins and a children's playground. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, these visits are relativley rare and in terms of substance, represent only a cordial exchange and in most cases are accompanieed by a symbolic Chinese donation. Therefore, this Indicator deserves and "insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: In March 15, 2023, the head of the small Levica (Left) party and an MP, Dimitar Apasiev , attended through video conferrence call, the world summit of the Chinese Communist Party. In April, 2023 another Levica representative atended a Bejing based "China -Central and Eastern Europe Youth Development Forum". Therefore this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. This is a small parliamentary opposition party with just two MP's in the 120 seat parliament, and its pro-Chinese enthusiasm is not shared by other prominent parties. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "insignificant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The former government of North Macedonia led by the right wing VMRO DPMNE party, in power from 2006 to 2016, had expressed on several occasions plans to open such a free zone to attract Chinese businesses. However, this did not come to fruition and individuals from the business sector have told us that the zones were never established mainly due to a lack of Chinese interest at that time. The current Social Democrat-led governments, from 2017 onwards, have not shown public interest for relaxing regulations or setting up special economic zones particularly for Chinese investors.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Deutsche Telecom and Austrian Telecom hold by far the biggest share in this sector, and PRC connected entities are not present.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence:
While the use of hardware from these companies was relatively common before 2020, that year North Macedonia signed a memorandum for safe 5G network with the United States that practically prohibited these purchases. This prevented Makedonski Telekom, owned ultimately by Deutsche Telecom, from purchasing equipment from Huawei for its 5G network. Thus, while in the past telecoms have signed such agreements for 3G and 4G equipment, they are now prohibited from doing so as 5G is about to be rolled out. Consequently, in 2022 Makedonski Telekom launched its 5G network but the equipment was purchased from Ericsson. It was the same case with the second telecom provider, A1, which is owned by Austrian Telecom, which also purchased its equipment from Ericsson.
However, the extent of the use of previously purchased Chinese 3G and 4G equipment by telecom operators is not fully clear. The regulatory body, the Agency for Electronic Communications, AEK, in 2022 and in 2023 said that the intent is for this equipment to be gradually phased out by the operators by the end of 2023. The operators however are reluctant to speak in detail about the pace of this process and whether it has been completed. So in essence there is circumstantial evidence that operators no longer purchase 4G equipment from Chinese producers and are phasing out the old equipment, but there is no way to verify that for sure.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: ISP's still use some Wi-Fi equipment from Huawei and ZTE that has been purchased before 2020. For example, such routers can still be found in some househoold as part of the equipment supplied by the providers but we were not able to find any data related to how widespread that is. Due to the secrecy of these agreements and the unwillingness of operators to disclose them, there is also no data on whether they are still in effect or have been effectivly terminated. A source fropm the regulatory body, the Agency for Electronic Communication told us that he is pretty sure that during 2023 operators have not signed new contracts for Chinese equipment, but he was not able to substantiate that with evidence. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The private national Telma TV has been running a show dedicated to China and China-North Macedonia relations, called “Nihao – Get to know China”, since 2021. The 30-minute-long monthly show portrays China in a vastly favorable light, emphasizing its culture, tradition as well as its modern achievements and economic might. Therefore, the indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The show has been running with the support by the Chinese Embassy in North Macedonia, but has very little viewership or impact. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.
